div.l: Aleyn vprist and þoughte or þat it dawe
I wol go crepen in / by my felawe
And fonde þe cradel / with his honde anoon
By god þoughte he al mys I haue mysgoon
Myn hede is toty / of my swynke to nyght
That maketh me þat I go nought a ryght
I woot wel by þe cradel I haue mysgo
Here lyth þe mellere / and his wyf also
And forth he gooth a twenty deueleway
Vn to þe bed / þere as þe meller lay
He wende haue cropen in by his felawe Iohn
And by þe meller / in he crepe anon
And caughte hym by þe nekke / and softe spake
And seide þou Iohn / þou swyneshede awake
For cristes saule / and here a noble game
For by þat lord þat called is seint Iame
As I haue þries in þis shorte nyght
Swyued þe mellers dought̉er þries bolt vpright
While þou hast as a coward ben agast
Ȝe false harlot / quod þe meller hast
A fals traytoʳur fals clerk quod he
Thou shalt be ded by goddes dignite
Who durste be so bold to disparage
My doughter þᵗat is comen of swich lynage
And by þe þrote bolle he caughte Alayn
And hente hym dispitousely agayn
And on þe nose he smote hym with his fist
Doun ran þe blody streem vpon his brist
And in þe flore with ⁊and nose ⁊and mouth to broke
They walwe as done two pigges in a poke
And vp þei gon and doıı̄un ageyn anon
Til þat the meller sporned at a stoon
And doıı̄un he fil bakward vp on his wyf
That wiste no þing of þis nyce stryf
For she was falle a slepe a litel wight
With Iohn þe Clerc þat waked hadde al nyght
And with fal out of hir sleep she brayde
Help holy cros of bromholme she sayde
In manus tuas / lorde to þe I calle
